net.gini.android.vision.noresults

Class NoResultsActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • AppCompatActivity
      • net.gini.android.vision.noresults.NoResultsActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NoResultsFragmentListener

    public class NoResultsActivity
extends AppCompatActivity
implements NoResultsFragmentListener

    Screen API

    When you use the Screen API, the NoResultsFragmentCompat displays hints that show how to best take a picture of a document.

    Customizing the No Results Screen

    Customizing the look of the No Results Screen is done via overriding of app resources.

    The following items are customizable:

    • Header icon: via images for mdpi, hdpi, xhdpi, xxhdpi, xxxhdpi named gv_alert_icon.png
    • Header text color: via the color resource named gv_noresults_header
    • Header text font: via overriding the style named GiniVisionTheme .NoResults.Header.TextStyle and setting an item named gvCustomFont with the path to the font file in your assets folder
    • Header text style: via overriding the style named GiniVisionTheme.NoResults.Header.TextStyle and setting an item named android:textStyle to normal, bold or italic
    • Header text size: via overriding the style named GiniVisionTheme.NoResults.Header.TextStyle and setting an item named android:textSize to the desired sp size
    • Headline text color: via the color resource named gv_noresults_headline
    • Headline text font: via overriding the style named GiniVisionTheme.NoResults.Headline.TextStyle and setting an item named gvCustomFont with the path to the font file in your assets folder
    • Headline text style: via overriding the style named GiniVisionTheme.NoResults.Headline.TextStyle and setting an item named android:textStyle to normal, bold or italic
    • Headline text size: via overriding the style named GiniVisionTheme.NoResults.Headline.TextStyle and setting an item named android:textSize to the desired sp size
    • Tip text color: via the color resource named gv_noresults_tip
    • Tip text font: via overriding the style named GiniVisionTheme.NoResults.Tip.TextStyle and setting an item named gvCustomFont with the path to the font file in your assets folder
    • Tip text style: via overriding the style named GiniVisionTheme.NoResults.Tip.TextStyle and setting an item named android:textStyle to normal, bold or italic
    • Tip text size: via overriding the style named GiniVisionTheme.NoResults.Tip.TextStyle and setting an item named android:textSize to the desired sp size
    • Tip image - Good lighting: via images for mdpi, hdpi, xhdpi, xxhdpi, xxxhdpi named gv_photo_tip_lighting.png
    • Tip image - Document should be flat: via images for mdpi, hdpi, xhdpi, xxhdpi, xxxhdpi named gv_photo_tip_flat.png
    • Tip image - Device should be parallel to document: via images for mdpi, hdpi, xhdpi,xxhdpi, xxxhdpi named gv_photo_tip_parallel.png
    • Tip image - Document should be aligned with corner guides: via images for mdpi, hdpi, xhdpi,xxhdpi, xxxhdpi named gv_photo_tip_align.png
    • Button color: via the color resource named gv_noresults_button
    • Button text color: via the color resource named gv_noresults_button_text
    • Background color: via the color resource named gv_noresults_background.

    Important: All overriden styles must have their respective Root. prefixed style as their parent. Ex.: the parent of GiniVisionTheme.Onboarding.Message.TextStyle must be Root.GiniVisionTheme.Onboarding.Message.TextStyle.

    Customizing the Action Bar

    Customizing the Action Bar is done via overriding of app resources and each one - except the title string resource - is global to all Activities (CameraActivity, NoResultsActivity, ReviewActivity, AnalysisActivity).

    The following items are customizable:

    • Background color: via the color resource named gv_action_bar (highly recommended for Android 5+: customize the status bar color via gv_status_bar)

      • onBackToCameraPressed

        public void onBackToCameraPressed()
        Description copied from interface: NoResultsFragmentListener

        Called when the button on the bottom of the No Results Screen was pressed. This button should lead the user back to the Camera Screen.

        Specified by:
        onBackToCameraPressed in interface NoResultsFragmentListener
